routers

Class Cygnus

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Router
      • routers.Cygnus

  • public class Cygnus
extends Router
    Provides the Cygnus router architecture as defined in the following paper:

    H. Gu, K. H. Mo, J. Xu, and W. Zhang, “A low-power low-cost optical router for optical networks-on-chip in multiprocessor systems-on-chip,” in VLSI, 2009. ISVLSI’09. IEEE Computer Society Annual Symposium on. IEEE, 2009, pp. 19–24.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class main.Router

        crossings, rings, waveguides

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Cygnus()
      Constructs the router object with several Waveguide, Crossing and MicroringResonator instances.
      Cygnus(javax.swing.JTextArea textArea)
      Constructs the router object with several Waveguide, Crossing and MicroringResonator instances.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void initialize()
      Initializes the router according to the guidelines of the basic Router class.

      • Methods inherited from class main.Router

        areSharedWaveguides, connectivityMatrixToString, crosstalkMatrixToString, getCrossings, getCrosstalkMatrix, getLossMatrix, getNumCrossings, getNumPorts, getNumRings, getNumWaveguides, getReadableRepresentation, getRings, getWaveguides, isValidSimultaneousCommunication, lossMatrixToString, printCrosstalk, printLoss

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cygnus

        public Cygnus()
        Constructs the router object with several Waveguide, Crossing and MicroringResonator instances. It will calls the initialize() method.

      • Cygnus

        public Cygnus(javax.swing.JTextArea textArea)
        Constructs the router object with several Waveguide, Crossing and MicroringResonator instances. It will calls the initialize() method.
        Parameters:
        textArea - The GUI element used to print messages

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the router according to the guidelines of the basic Router class. This method must set the three maps containing the ring, crossing and waveguide objects.
        Specified by:
        initialize in class Router
        See Also:
        Router
